page.title: 09BICKLEIGH CofE FIRST SCHOOL
page.content: The first village school, 1870, opposite the church, is now a private residence. The present school, opened in 1960, has an average of 60-70 pupils on roll, who are conveyed by 5 mini-buses from neighbouring Butter- leigh and Cadeleigh. The age range is 5-9. Pupils later transfer to a Middle School in Tiverton. The school has 3 classes and 3 teachers. There are good playing facilities, an outdoor swimming pool, a small fish pond and a pottery kiln. Meals are cooked on the premises. The Head Teacher is released from teaching duties one day per week. The Vicar calls weekly. Pupils present services in church at festival times. Older children make music with guitars, recorders and percussion. Out of school activities are regular and include a week's residential visit to the Isle of Wight.
